step1.sentence: Our team holds weekly meetings to share knowledge about the latest industry trends.

step2.story: After attending a data science conference, Maya couldn't wait to share knowledge with her colleagues. She organized a lunch-and-learn session and walked everyone through the key insights. By the end, three team members had already started applying the new techniques to their projects.

step3.story: When Daniel first joined the nonprofit, he noticed that each department worked in isolation, rarely communicating with one another. He proposed a simple idea: a monthly open forum where anyone could share knowledge from their area of expertise. At first, only a handful of people showed up. But after the marketing team's presentation helped the fundraising department double their online donations, word spread quickly. Within six months, the forum became the most popular event in the organization. Daniel realized that the willingness to share knowledge openly had transformed not just productivity, but the entire culture of the workplace.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 지식을 나누다, 즉 자신이 알고 있는 정보나 경험을 다른 사람에게 전달하는 것을 의미합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 직장, 학교, 커뮤니티 등에서 자신의 전문 지식이나 경험을 다른 사람들과 공유할 때 폭넓게 사용됩니다. 단순한 정보 전달뿐 아니라 서로 배우고 성장하자는 협력적 뉘앙스를 담고 있습니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'share'는 고대 영어 'scearu'(나누다, 분배하다)에서, 'knowledge'는 중세 영어 'knowleche'(앎, 인식)에서 유래했습니다. 두 단어가 결합하여 '알고 있는 것을 함께 나누다'라는 자연스러운 연어 표현이 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 격식체와 비격식체 모두에서 자연스럽게 쓰이며, 특히 교육·비즈니스 맥락에서 긍정적이고 협력적인 태도를 나타냅니다. 'teach'보다 수평적이고 쌍방향적인 느낌을 줍니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Experienced engineers should share knowledge with junior developers.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 경험 많은 엔지니어들은 주니어 개발자들과 지식을 나눠야 합니다.
